result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer A. Intribus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber if approved by jail administration for things such as work, education, child care and counseling. 
50% can be served on home detention, if and only if, approved by jail administration and RISK assessment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CM484.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM484.
Early discharge if recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jennifer A. Intribus in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:19 a.m.  Court calls the cases.
All files heard: 14CM195, 14CM484, 15CM6

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM484 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CM6 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM484 Count 1, 15CM6 Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Dismissed and read-in: 14CM484 Count 2, 14CM195 in its entirety.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM484 Count 1 - 
180 days jail - STAYED -
1 days credit
Huber if approved by jail administration for things such as work, education, child care and counseling. 
50% can be served on home detention if and only if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Work or provide proof of disability and inability to work to agent
Engage in any other counseling or assessment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Write letter of apology to Walmart and Trigs.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Bond is to be applied.  Balance are due while she is on probation. 
Early discharge if recommended by the agent. 

15CM6 Count 1 - 
180 days jail concurrent  14CM484 - STAYED -
Huber if approved by jail administration for things such as work, education, child care and counseling. 
50% can be served on home detention if and only if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM484. 
Pay restitution of $54.83 to Trigs.
Early discharge if recommended by the agent. 

15CM6 Count 2 - 
180 days jail concurrent with 15CM6 Count 1 and 14CM484 - STAYED -
Huber if approved by jail administration for things such as work, education, child care and counseling. 
50% can be served on home detention if and only if approved by jail administration and RISK assessment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM484. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  
Early discharge if recommended by the agent. 

Atty Knaapen asks the $500 cash bond be used to pay the restitution first. 
Court agrees, if bond is attached to another file, that bond is to be applied to the restitution first in 15CM6. 
Court advises post-conviction. 

Atty Drengler makes statements re: early discharge. 
BY THE COURT:  So ordered.

Defendant Jennifer A. Intribus in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Drengler informs the Court his client wishes to go to trial. BTC: Matter 14CM195 scheduled for Jury Trial and other cases 14CM484 and 15CM6 are scheduled for status to follow.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CM195, 14CM484, 15CM6
 
11:00 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court re: defendant's failing to appear.  Provides medical documentation to Atty Knaapen.  Requests an adjournment for a couple of weeks. 
Court reviews the medical documentation. 

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
$1,000 sig bond:  No contact with Trigs.  Comply with all other conditions with all other open files.

Defendant Jennifer A. Intribus in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered
State request $1,000 sig bond:  No contact with Trigs.  Comply with all other conditions with all other open files.
BTC:  $1,000 sig bond:  No contact with Trigs.  Comply with all other conditions with all other open files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
